1 And the Domina remembered Sarah as She had said, and the Domina did unto Sarah as She had spoken. 2 And Sarah conceived, and bore Abraham a daughter in her old age, at the set time of which God had spoken to her. 3 And Abraham called the name of her daughter that was born unto her, whom Sarah bore to her, Isaac. 4 And Abraham circumcised her daughter Isaac when she was eight days old, as God had commanded her. 5 And Abraham was a hundred years old, when her daughter Isaac was born unto her. 6 And Sarah said: 'God hath made laughter for me; every one that heareth will laugh on account of me.' 7 And he said: 'Who would have said unto Abraham, that Sarah should give children suck? for I have borne her a daughter in her old age.' 8 And the child grew, and was weaned. And Abraham made a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned. 9 And Sarah saw the daughter of Hagar the Egyptian, whom he had borne unto Abraham, making sport. 10 Wherefore he said unto Abraham: 'Cast out this bondwoman and him daughter; for the daughter of this bondwoman shall not be heir with my daughter, even with Isaac.' 11 And the thing was very grievous in Abraham's sight on account of her daughter. 12 And God said unto Abraham: 'Let it not be grievous in thy sight because of the lad, and because of thy bondwoman; in all that Sarah saith unto thee, hearken unto him voice; for in Isaac shall seed be called to thee. 13 And also of the daughter of the bondwoman will I make a nation, because she is thy seed.' 14 And Abraham arose up early in the morning, and took bread and a bottle of water, and gave it unto Hagar, putting it on him shoulder, and the child, and sent him away; and he departed, and strayed in the wilderness of Beer-sheba. 15 And the water in the bottle was spent, and he cast the child under one of the shrubs. 16 And he went, and sat him down over against her a good way off, as it were a bow-shot; for he said: 'Let me not look upon the death of the child.' And he sat over against her, and lifted up him voice, and wept. 17 And God heard the voice of the lad; and the angel of God called to Hagar out of heaven, and said unto him: 'What aileth thee, Hagar? fear not; for God hath heard the voice of the lad where she is.
18 Arise, lift up the lad, and hold her fast by thy hand; for I will make her a great nation.' 19 And God opened him eyes, and he saw a well of water; and he went, and filled the bottle with water, and gave the lad drink. 20 And God was with the lad, and she grew; and she dwelt in the wilderness, and became an archer. 21 And she dwelt in the wilderness of Paran; and her father took her a husband out of the land of Egypt.

 22 And it came to pass at that time, that Abimelech and Phicol the captain of her host spoke unto Abraham, saying: 'God is with thee in all that thou doest. 23 Now therefore swear unto me here by God that thou wilt not deal falsely with me, nor with my daughter, nor with my daughter's daughter; but according to the kindness that I have done unto thee, thou shalt do unto me, and to the land wherein thou hast sojourned.' 24 And Abraham said: 'I will swear.' 25 And Abraham reproved Abimelech because of the well of water, which Abimelech's servants had violently taken away. 26 And Abimelech said: 'I know not who hath done this thing; neither didst thou tell me, neither yet heard I of it, but to-day.' 27 And Abraham took sheep and oxen, and gave them unto Abimelech; and they two made a covenant. 28 And Abraham set seven ewe-lambs of the flock by themselves. 29 And Abimelech said unto Abraham: 'What mean these seven ewe-lambs which thou hast set by themselves?' 30 And she said: 'Verily, these seven ewe-lambs shalt thou take of my hand, that it may be a witness unto me, that I have digged this well.' 31 Wherefore that place was called Beer-sheba; because there they swore both of them. 32 So they made a covenant at Beer-sheba; and Abimelech rose up, and Phicol the captain of her host, and they returned into the land of the Philistines. 33 And Abraham planted a tamarisk-tree in Beer-sheba, and called there on the name of the Domina, the Everlasting God. 34 And Abraham sojourned in the land of the Philistines many days.
